subject: RE: [junit] junit - integration with visual cafe
msgSnippet: I ve been forced to use VC recently.  We run our tests via the Project- Options command.  In effect you make the main of your project the test you want to run
messageBody:
I've been forced to use VC recently. We run our tests via
the Project->Options command. In effect you make the main
of your project the test you want to run and invoke the
junit.textui.TestRunner in the mains of your tests.

I have no idea if VC has an API which would actually allow
you to integrate JUnit with VC.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> Mike Choe wrote:
> > hi all.
> > how can you define your own testing criteria in JUnit?
> > i think there's a way and i thought i read about it somewhere but i'm
> > blanking out.
>
> It depends what you mean by "testing criteria".
>
> You can extend the TestCase class to have additional assert methods if
> you want to routinely check on different things. For example, I've got a
> group of class doing a fair bit of work with reflection. I ended up
> defining a new test base class, and added a method like this:
>
> public void assertType(Class expectedType, Object o) {
> assertNotNull("Can't really check the type of a null object", 0);
> assert("Expected type <" + expectedType.toString() + ">. Actual Type:
> <" + o.getClass().toString() + ">",
> o instanceof expectedType);
> }
>
> Is this the sort of thing you mean?
>
> Robert.
